app.title: BrightByte Cloud (beta)
app.presentation: Who are you? Please, select your identity file and enter the security passphrase. Login in is a local operation, no information will be sent to any server.
app.fileNotLoaded: Please, first select a valid identity file
app.wrongFile: The format of the selected file is incorrect
app.connectionFailure: There is no node available for connection.
app.enterCredentials: Enter your credentials to sign in
app.termsDescription: BrightByte is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. Contact your BrightByte provider for more information.
app.explanationText: In order to sign up for BrightByte you need to create and identity file. This identity file contains your public and private keys, being the private key protected with the password introduced below. Please enter the password to protect your identity file, read and agree the terms and conditions and click on the button to generate and download your identity file. IMPORTANT: do not lose your identity file, your user account fully depends on it and cannot be recovered in case of loss.
app.versionOutdated: Your BrightByte version is outdated. The page is going to refresh.
app.fileNotSelected: File was not selected correctly. Please select a file.

addCommit.title: Add commit or PR

addCommit.loadMoreRepositoriesMessage: Is the repository you were looking for not listed? Try load more repositories
addCommit.randomReviewersDescription: Up to four users are picked among the available team members
addCommit.wrongWorkspace: The workspace is wrong, please notify your team administrator.
addCommit.wrongOrganization: The organization is wrong, please notify your team administrator.

commits.qualityDescription:
Quality of Code
This criterion measures how much the code complies with the software development principles and best practices (e.g. simplicity, cleanliness, readability, maintainability)
commits.difficultyDescription:
Difficulty
How complex is the problem which this code solves?
commits.confidenceDescription:
Reviewer confidence
How much expertise do you consider to have in the technologies used in this commit?

ranking.name: Name
ranking.nCommitsReviewByMe: Number of commits reviewed by me
ranking.nCommitsToReviewByMe: Number of commits to review by me
ranking.notQualified:
Not qualified yet
You still need to make {{pendingReviews}} reviews and {{pendingCommits}} commits to participate in the season. Your agreed percentage is {{agreedPercentage}}%

review.positiveVote: The author agrees with this review

setProfile.noWorkspaceAvailableYet: There isn't any workspace available to this team.
setProfile.noOrganizationAvailableYet: There isn't any organization available to this team.
setProfile.alreadyRegisteredError: One or more users are already registered to team.
setProfile.invalidWorkspace: Please, type the name of the new workspace
setProfile.invalidOrganization: Please, type the name of the new organization
setProfile.newWorkspaceError: Cannot add the new workspace. Please try again later or contact your service provider.
setProfile.newOrganizationError: Cannot add the new organization. Please try again later or contact your service provider.
setProfile.workspaceErrorBackendDown: Backend service is currently is not available. Click on 'Skip' and try to set the workspace later on 'Team Settings' tab.
setProfile.organizationErrorBackendDown: Backend service is currently is not available. Click on 'Skip' and try to set the organization later on 'Team Settings' tab.
setProfile.deleteWorkspaceError: Cannot delete the workspace. Please try again later or contact your service provider.
setProfile.bitbucketNotAvailable: Bitbucket service not available. Please try again later or contact your service provider.
setProfile.githubNotAvailable: Github service not available. Please try again later or contact your service provider.
setProfile.workspacesDescription: A workspace is how Bitbucket organizes different streams of work in an user account. BrightByte uses this workspaces when importing commits and PRs via the batch upload feature.
setProfile.organizationsDescription: Organizations are accounts where businesses and open-source projects can collaborate across many projects at once. BrightByte uses this organizations when importing commits.
setProfile.workspacesAndOrganizationsFullDescriptio: BrightByte uses workspaces from Bitbucket and organizations from Github when importing commits and PRs via the batch upload feature. Your can find the name of your workspace or organization by looking on a the url of a commit. The words after 'bitbucket.org/' and before '/commits' is the workspace name. The words after 'github.com/' and before '/commit' is the organization name.
setProfile.teamRulesDescription: The team review rules are the set of criteria that governs review process in a team. This text should be clear enough so all the members of the team understand how to perform the code review and score each commit or PR.
setProfile.teamSeasons: The duration of the seasons of your team are the following number of days
setProfile.seasonLengthSuccessMsg: The duration of the season has been changed correctly
setProfile.seasonLengthErrorMsg: Cannot change the duration of the season. Please try again later or contact your service provider.
setProfile.errorSettingThreshold: Error setting season threshold. Please try again later or contact your service provider.
setProfile.successSettingThreshold: New season qualification thresholds set successfully
setProfile.noAvailableInvitations: There are no invitations available at the moment
setProfile.thresholdDescription: Users need to exceed the season qualification thresholds configured in order to participate in the current season.
setProfile.randomReviewersDescription: Up to four users are picked among the available team members

commitReview.description: Enter the explanation of your review

alerts.claimMsg: Do you want to make a complaint?
alerts.allowPopUpWindow: You must allow popup windows to continue.
alerts.notForMobileDevice: BrightByte is a desktop web application. To see the full web go to a desktop browser or use desktop mode on your device.

achievements.unlockedAchievement: You have unlocked a new achievement

errors.backendOffline: The BrightByte server seems to be down. Please try again later or contact your service provider. The service will keep working but some features (batch commit upload, achievements, profile image) may not work temporarily.
errors.tryAgain: Please try again later or contact the system administrator if the problem persists.

social.facebookShareText: I'm using BrightByte, a reputation network for code developers. Check it out at http://brightbyteapp.com
social.twitterShareText: I'm using BrightByte, a reputation network for code developers. Check it out at
social.achievementText: I've just got "{{title}}" achievement in BrightByte. Go check it out!

tutorialSlides.afterLoginTutorialCommitText1: Add your commits or PRs clicking on
tutorialSlides.afterLoginTutorialCommitText2: contribute button of the left side menu or in the upper right corner
tutorialSlides.afterLoginTutorialCommitText3: of commits page. You can do it manually or by batch with the Bitbucket integration:
tutorialSlides.afterLoginTutorialReviewText1: Review your colleagues code. There are 3 categories to rate:
tutorialSlides.afterLoginTutorialReviewText2: quality of the code, difficulty of the changes and your confidence
tutorialSlides.afterLoginTutorialRankingText: In the ranking page you can check your position based on your reputation. BrightByte ranking is divided in seasons in which every user has a chance to get to the first place. There is also a global ranking in which you are able to check your accumulated engagement index.
tutorialSlides.afterLoginTutorialFinalText: Start uploading and reviewing your first commits or PRs
